text: Hello, Matthew,what are you doing here so late?

text: -I could use that to better advantage.-All right, Matthew.

text: may cause my childrento become conceited.

title: House of Wax

text: -Can't you read the sign?-I'm sorry.
title: House of Wax

text: Look, where'd you get the facefor this guy that shot Lincoln?
title: House of Wax

text: -From photographs.-They take them at that time?
title: House of Wax

text: If you go to the City Library...
title: House of Wax

text: you'll find the volume of Mathew Brady'sphotos taken during the Civil War.
title: House of Wax

text: -Do you work here?-Yeah.
title: House of Wax

text: -You make these things?-Some of them.
title: House of Wax

text: What's your name?
title: House of Wax

text: Leon Averill. What's yours?
title: House of Wax

text: Jim Shane. I'm an engineer on the9th Avenue El. It was nice meeting you.
title: House of Wax

text: You know me. I'm no good at names,but I don't forget faces.
title: House of Wax

text: If I can take the muff off of that oneI might be able to place it.
title: House of Wax

text: It was a long time ago.
title: House of Wax

text: Mr. Wallace, I'm Lt. Brennan. Sgt. Shane.
title: House of Wax

text: -Glad to know you.-Won't you sit down?
title: House of Wax

text: -Sorry I kept you waiting.-That's all right.
title: House of Wax

text: This is the first time I've beenasked to come to Police Headquarters.
title: House of Wax

text: What am I suspected of?
title: House of Wax

text: Nothing. We thought perhapsyou might be able to help us.
title: House of Wax

text: We heard that your partneris the same Professor Jarrod...
title: House of Wax

text: whose museum on 24th Streetburned down some time ago.
title: House of Wax

text: That's true.
title: House of Wax

text: This Professor Jarrod wassupposed to have been killed in the fire.
title: House of Wax

text: -Apparently, a slight mistake.-You suspect him of some criminal act?
title: House of Wax

text: -We haven't a thing on him.-We're curious.
title: House of Wax

text: So is the insurance company.
title: House of Wax

text: What do you know about his employees?
title: House of Wax

text: -There's Scott Andrews, a protï¿½gï¿½ of mine.-Yes, we know of him.
title: House of Wax

text: Then there's Igor, deaf-mute,and Leon Averill, who does the wax work.
title: House of Wax

text: Averill's an odd character.Periodical drunkard, but a fine artist.
title: House of Wax

text: I've seen some of his sketches.One of the Savior with his disciples.
title: House of Wax

text: Beautiful work.
title: House of Wax

text: -I'm afraid I haven't been much help.-You never can tell. Thank you.
title: House of Wax

text: -Please don't mention this to your partner.-I won't.
title: House of Wax

text: You know, I gamble on Jarrod.
title: House of Wax

text: He's strange, unpredictable,but I think he's a man of integrity.
title: House of Wax

text: -I'm sure of it. Thank you very much.-Not at all. Good day, gentlemen.
title: House of Wax

text: Remember I told youI knew the man with the whiskers?
title: House of Wax

text: Do you remember that artist in Sing Singwho painted The Last Supper on his cell?
title: House of Wax

text: Hendricks. They called him a geniusand gave him a parole.
title: House of Wax

text: But when they turned him loose,he became a drunk.
title: House of Wax

text: He broke parole a year ago.We've had him on the wanted list since.
title: House of Wax

text: -Carl Hendricks?-That's him. Alias, Leon Averill.
title: House of Wax

text: -Bring him in.-Can do.
title: House of Wax

text: A little more bitternessin that face, my boy.
title: House of Wax

text: Remember, this fellow has beenbadly used by the world...
title: House of Wax

text: and he despises all the people in it.
title: House of Wax

text: Deepen those linesaround the corner of the mouth.
title: House of Wax

text: Not too much.
title: House of Wax

text: There. That's better.
title: House of Wax

text: What I wouldn't giveto have those fingers of yours.
title: House of Wax

text: -Thank you, Mr. Jarrod.-I'm sorry I kept you so late tonight, Scott.
title: House of Wax

text: That's all right.Miss Allen is meeting me here.
title: House of Wax

text: It's her birthday.We're going to celebrate at Chiles'.
title: House of Wax

text: Charming creature.
title: House of Wax

text: I was worried. The shock of findingthat murdered girl gave her strange ideas.
title: House of Wax

text: I know.
title: House of Wax

text: I took her to Lt. Brennan, he set her right.
title: House of Wax

text: That's very good now. Excellent.
title: House of Wax

text: Before you go, would you mindrunning over to Metzgers for me?
title: House of Wax

text: -Metzgers?-Where they make the artificial flowers.
title: House of Wax

text: They're doing a backgroundfor this new group. Take a look at it.
title: House of Wax

text: You know what I want.Advise them on the color scheme.
title: House of Wax

text: I'd go myself,but it's so hard for me to get about.
title: House of Wax

text: I know. I'll be glad to do it.I'll go right now.
title: House of Wax

text: Thank you very much.
title: House of Wax

text: I followed him through his bender.
title: House of Wax

text: Sometimes, he gets the shakes so bad,you expect to see his teeth fall off.
title: House of Wax

text: -Is this all he had on him?-Yes.
title: House of Wax

text: No money?
title: House of Wax

text: Gold.
title: House of Wax

text: "To Wilbur Patterson....
title: House of Wax

text: "With affection and admiration.
title: House of Wax

text: "City Attorney's Office.December 25, 1900."
title: House of Wax

text: Where did you get this?
title: House of Wax

text: -I found it.-Where?
title: House of Wax

text: -On the El.-What line?
title: House of Wax

text: -Third Avenue, downtown.-When?
title: House of Wax

text: I don't remember, it was months ago.
title: House of Wax

text: -Book him on suspicion of murder.-No. I found that.
title: House of Wax

text: I never knew the man who owned it.I never saw him.
title: House of Wax

text: Lock him up.
title: House of Wax

text: Please don't put me in a cell. I'm sick.
title: House of Wax

text: Can't you see my nerves are all shattered?
title: House of Wax

text: Look, please give me one little....
title: House of Wax

text: Can I have one little drink--
title: House of Wax

text: You're not going to get anythinguntil you tell us where you got this watch.
title: House of Wax

text: -Take him out.-Let's go.
title: House of Wax

text: You shouldn't have done that, my dear.
title: House of Wax

text: It is Cathy.
title: House of Wax

text: It's Cathy's body under the wax.
title: House of Wax

text: I knew it. I knew it all the time.
title: House of Wax

text: Everything I ever lovedhas been taken away from me.
title: House of Wax

text: Not you, my Marie Antoinette,for I will give you eternal life.
title: House of Wax

text: This is where I recreated my Joan of Arc.It's an interesting process.
title: House of Wax

text: If you have patience with me, my dear,I'll show you how it's done.
title: House of Wax

text: I can't stand it.
title: House of Wax

text: All right.
title: House of Wax

text: All right, I'll tell you what I know.
title: House of Wax

text: Patterson was killedbecause he looked like Booth.
title: House of Wax

text: -You killed him.-No, not l. Jarrod, at the waxworks.
title: House of Wax

text: His hands were no good.He had to take subjects from life.
title: House of Wax

text: -You helped him?-No, they were already dead.
title: House of Wax

text: What about Burke?
title: House of Wax

text: He's there, too. In wax.
title: House of Wax

text: He was the onewho set fire to the old museum.
title: House of Wax

text: Jarrod came out of it alive, but insane.
title: House of Wax

text: -Cathy Gray?-Joan of Arc. That's Cathy.
title: House of Wax

text: She's there with all the rest of them.The whole place is a morgue.
title: House of Wax

text: He'll do the same to Sue Allen,if he gets his hands on her.
title: House of Wax

text: You've got to stop himbefore he does any more killing.
title: House of Wax

text: That look of horror spoils your lovely face.
title: House of Wax

text: What if it should show,even through the wax?
title: House of Wax

text: Are you in there?
title: House of Wax

text: Where's Sue?
title: House of Wax

text: Where is she?
title: House of Wax

text: The end will come quickly, my love.
title: House of Wax

text: There's a pain beyond pain,an agony so intense...
title: House of Wax

text: it shocks the mind into instant oblivion.
title: House of Wax

text: We'll find immortality together...
title: House of Wax

text: for they'll remember me through you.
title: House of Wax

text: Where's Jarrod?
title: House of Wax

text: Andrews, where's Jarrod?
title: House of Wax

text: In the cellar. He's got Sue.
title: House of Wax

text: Take care of him.
title: House of Wax

text: The People's Exhibit Number One.
title: House of Wax

text: You almost lost your head. Would youcare to keep that one as a spare?
title: House of Wax

text: No, thank you.
title: House of Wax

text: We'll never forget you and your men.Thanks to you, we're still alive.
title: House of Wax

text: But every time I shave,I can still feel that guillotine blade.
title: House of Wax

text: -Please, let's not talk about it anymore.-Yes, you're right.
title: House of Wax

text: Mr. Brennan, thank youfor the use of your coat.
title: House of Wax

text: -That was nothing.-It meant a lot to me.
title: House of Wax

text: When I foundyou weren't dressed too warmly...
title: House of Wax

text: I didn't want you to catch a cold.
title: House of Wax

text: Goodbye, Mr. Brennan,and thanks for everything.
title: House of Wax

text: -Bless you, Mr. Shane.-Thank you, Miss Allen.
title: House of Wax

text: By the time this guygets out of Sing Sing...
title: House of Wax

text: this head will grow a long beard.
